titles: Three letters declaring the strange odd preceedings of Protestant divines when they write against Catholicks : by the example of Dr Taylor's Dissuasive against popery, Mr Whitbies Reply in the behalf of Dr Pierce against Cressy, and Dr Owens Animadversions on Fiat lux / written by J.V.C. ; the one of them to a friend, the other to a foe, the third to a person indifferent.
author: J. V. C. (John Vincent Canes), d. 1672.
notes: Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
Imperfect: all after p. 406 lacking in filmed copy.
keywords: Whitby, Daniel, 1638-1726. --  Romish doctrines not from the beginning.
Owen, John, 1616-1683. --  Animadversions on a treatise intituled Fiat lux.
